wikipedia_page.main: William Laidler Leaf (1791-1874) was a wealthy silk merchant and philanthropist.

response: Leaf Hall is a grade II listed former working men's institute in Eastbourne, East Sussex. It was built in 1863–64 to a design by Robert Knott Blessley in a continental gothic style for the philanthropist William Leaf.Butlins site among landmarks protected by Historic England. BBC News, 18 December 2017. Retrieved 18 December 2017. It was closely associated with the temperance movement.The History of Leaf Hall – Eastbourne’s oldest public building. Leaf Hall Community Arts Centre. Retrieved 18 December 2017. The building now serves as a community arts centre.
In London he received financial support from his friend and correspondent William Leaf and did not have to continue his journey.
